      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
            def charged_orders
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              loop_stripe_orders(status: 'paid', limit: 1000) do |stripe_order|
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                add_to_quickbooks(stripe_order)
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              end
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            end
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          1
          
            def add_to_quickbooks(stripe_order)
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              # ECOMTODO Fill in with quickbooks connect code
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            end
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          1
          
            def cancelled_orders
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              loop_stripe_orders(status: 'cancelled', limit: 1000) do |stripe_order|
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                add_to_quickbooks(stripe_order)
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
              end
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            end
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          1
          
            def loop_stripe_orders(options)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              loop do
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                stripe_orders = Stripe::Order.all(options)
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                stripe_orders.each do |stripe_order|
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                  yield(stripe_order)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                end
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                break unless stripe_orders.has_more
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            end
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          end
        
      44.

            def self.perform(stripe_order_id)
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              Rails.logger.info("Stripe Order #{stripe_order_id} - Performing Charge")
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              stripe_order = StripeOrder.find(stripe_order_id)
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              Rails.logger.info("Stripe Order #{stripe_order.id} - Found Stripe Order, Sending to stripe")
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              stripe_order.send_to_stripe
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              Rails.logger.info("Stripe Order #{stripe_order.id} - Flushing librato metrics")
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              Librato.tracker.flush
        
      15. 
      
        
    15.

      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            end

          class StripeWebhookProcessor
        
      2.

          1
          
            @queue = :stripe_webhook_processor
        
      3.

          1
          
            def self.perform(stripe_event_id)
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
              Rails.logger.info("Processing Stripe Webhook #{stripe_event_id}")
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
              stripe_event = StripeEvent.find(stripe_event_id)
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              return if stripe_event.processed
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              # For the reports
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              case stripe_event.event_type
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              when 'charge.succeeded'
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              when 'charge.refunded'
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                charge_refunded(stripe_event_id)
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              when 'charge.dispute.created'
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                chargeback_created(stripe_event_id)
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              when 'charge.dispute.closed'
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                chargeback_closed(stripe_event_id)
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
              end
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
              # For the future orders
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              case stripe_event.event_type
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
              when 'order.created'
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                order_created(stripe_event)
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
              when 'order.payment_failed'
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                order_failed(stripe_event)
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              when 'order.payment_succeeded'
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                order_charged(stripe_event)
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              when 'order.updated'
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                # Unused
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
              end
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
              # For the ecommerce products
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
              case stripe_event.event_type
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
              when 'sku.created'
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                sku_handler(stripe_event)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              when 'sku.updated'
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                sku_handler(stripe_event)
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
              when 'product.created'
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                product_handler(stripe_event)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              when 'product.updated'
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                product_handler(stripe_event)
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
              stripe_event.processed = true
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
              stripe_event.save
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            end
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
          
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
            def charge_refunded(stripe_event)
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              order_description = stripe_event.data["object"]["description"]
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              od = order_description.match("Payment for order (.*)")
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
              if od[1].present?
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                stripe_order = Stripe::Order.retrieve(od[1])
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                stripe_order.status = 'cancelled'
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                stripe_order.save
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          1
          
            def order_charged(stripe_event)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              # Send to quickbooks
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
              # Send email notifications
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
            end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          1
          
            def order_failed(stripe_event)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              # Handle failure
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
              # Send email notifications
        
      65.

            end
        
      66.

      67.

              Rails.cache.delete("stripe_products")
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            end
        
      70.

      71.

          1

            end

            def initialize(user_id)
        
      28.

            def sync

            def sync_mailchimp(options = {premium: true, joule: true})
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              list_id = Rails.configuration.mailchimp[:list_id]
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              member_info = Gibbon::API.lists.member_info({:id => list_id, :emails => [{:email => @user.email}]})
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              @logger.info member_info.inspect
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              if member_info['success_count'] == 0
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                @logger.warn "User not found in MailChimp #{member_info.inspect}"
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                return
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
              elsif member_info['data'][0]['status'] == 'unsubscribed'
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                @logger.warn "User unsubscribed from list #{member_info.inspect}"
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                return
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              end
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
              member_info = member_info['data'][0]
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
              
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              if member_info['status'] != 'subscribed'
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                @logger.warn "User not subscribed to list, actual status [#{member_info['status']}]"
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                return
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
              end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
              # TODO - This is a quick fix that will still remove the user from groups
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              # other than premium and joule purchase
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
              groups = []
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              if options[:premium]
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                add_to_group_param(groups, member_info, :premium_group_id, PREMIUM_GROUP_NAME, @user.premium?)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
              if options[:joule]
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                add_to_group_param(groups, member_info, :joule_group_id, JOULE_PURCHASE_GROUP_NAME, @user.joule_purchase_count > 0)
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
              end
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
          
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              add_to_groups(groups)
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            end
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          1
          
            def sync_shopify
        
      73.

              Shopify::Customer.sync_user @user

    74. 
          
          
            end
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          1
          
            def country_from_intercom
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
              Rails.logger.info "Retriving intercom user for id #{@user.id}"
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              begin
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                intercom_user = Intercom::User.find(:user_id => @user.id)
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
              rescue Intercom::ResourceNotFound
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                Rails.logger.info "No intercom user found for user #{@user.id} with email #{@user.email}"
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                return nil
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
              end
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
          
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
              Rails.logger.info "Intercom user location data: #{intercom_user.location_data.inspect}"
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
              begin
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                intercom_user.location_data.country_name
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
              rescue Intercom::AttributeNotSetError
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                Rails.logger.info "Intercom location_data not set"
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                return nil
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
              end
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
            end
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          1
          
            private
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
          
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          1
          
            def add_to_group_param(groups, member_info, group_id, group_name, db_value)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
              mailchimp_value = in_mailchimp_group?(member_info, group_id, group_name)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
          
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
              @logger.info "#{group_name}: Mailchimp [#{mailchimp_value}], ChefSteps [#{db_value}]"
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
          
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              if mailchimp_value && !db_value
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                msg = "User #{@user.id} is a #{group_name} in mailchimp and not the database"
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                @logger.error msg
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                raise msg
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
              end
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
          
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
              if !db_value
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                @logger.info "Not a #{group_name}"
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                return
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
              end
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
              groups << [group_id, group_name]
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
            end
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
          
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          1
          
            def add_to_groups (groups)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
              # Note - if more attributes are added to the group then those values will
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
              # need to be copied from the initial read request or else they will be
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
              # deleted.
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
              groupings = groups.collect do |id, name|
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                {id: Rails.configuration.mailchimp[id], groups: [name]}
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
              end
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
              merge_vars = {
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                  groupings: groupings
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
              }
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
              
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              country = country_from_intercom()
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              if country
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                merge_vars[COUNTRY_MERGE_VAR] = country
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
              end
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
              Gibbon::API.lists.update_member(
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                id: Rails.configuration.mailchimp[:list_id],
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                email: { email: @user.email },
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                merge_vars: merge_vars,
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                replace_interests: false
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              )
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
            end
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
          
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          1
          
            def in_mailchimp_group?(member_info, id, group_name)
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
              return false unless member_info
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
              return false unless member_info['GROUPINGS']
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
          
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
              group_outer = member_info['GROUPINGS'].find do |e|
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                e['id'] == Rails.configuration.mailchimp[id]
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
              end
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
              return false unless group_outer
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              return false unless group_outer['groups']
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              group_inner = group_outer['groups'].find do |e|
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                e['name'] == group_name
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              end
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
              return false if group_inner.nil?
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
          
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
              return true if group_inner["interested"] == true
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
          
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
              return false
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
            end
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
          end

    1.

          module ActsAsSanitized
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          1
          
            extend ActiveSupport::Concern
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
            included do
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          5
          
              attr_accessor :bypass_sanitization
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            end
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
            module ActiveRecordExtension
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          1
          
              def sanitize_input(*args)
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          5
          
                before_validation do
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          1
          
                  return if defined?(self.bypass_sanitization) && self.bypass_sanitization == true # Doing an actual comparison to true so that it can't be truthy it has to be true.
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          1
          
                  args.each do |field|
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          1
          
                    self[field] = Sanitize.fragment(self[field], Sanitize::Config.merge(Sanitize::Config::RELAXED, remove_contents: true))
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                  end
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                end
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              end
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            end
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          end

            def hours_to_pretty_time
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
              case
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
              when self >= 8736
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
                years = self.hours/1.year
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
                # ActionController::Base.helpers.pluralize(years, "year")

    7. 
          
          
                "#{years} year"
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              when self >= 720
        
      9. 
      
        
    9.

    13.

    14. 
          
          
                # ActionController::Base.helpers.pluralize(weeks, "week")
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                "#{weeks} week"
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              when self >= 24
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                days = self.hours/1.day

    18.

      25.

            end

      18.

            # ==> Configuration for any authentication mechanism
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            # Configure which keys are used when authenticating a user. The default is
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            # just :email. You can configure it to use [:username, :subdomain], so for
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            # authenticating a user, both parameters are required. Remember that those
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
            # parameters are used only when authenticating and not when retrieving from
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            # session. If you need permissions, you should implement that in a before filter.
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
            # You can also supply a hash where the value is a boolean determining whether
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            # or not authentication should be aborted when the value is not present.
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            # config.authentication_keys = [ :email ]
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            # Configure parameters from the request object used for authentication. Each entry
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            # given should be a request method and it will automatically be passed to the
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            # find_for_authentication method and considered in your model lookup. For instance,
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            # if you set :request_keys to [:subdomain], :subdomain will be used on authentication.
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            # The same considerations mentioned for authentication_keys also apply to request_keys.
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
            # config.request_keys = []
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            # Configure which authentication keys should be case-insensitive.
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            # These keys will be downcased upon creating or modifying a user and when used
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            # to authenticate or find a user. Default is :email.
        
      38.

      40.

            # Configure which authentication keys should have whitespace stripped.
        
      41.

    45. 
          
          
            # Tell if authentication through request.params is enabled. True by default.
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            # It can be set to an array that will enable params authentication only for the
        
      47. 
      
        
    47.

      48.

      54.

            # For bcrypt, this is the cost for hashing the password and defaults to 10. If

      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
            #
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            # Limiting the stretches to just one in testing will increase the performance of
        
      82.

            # your test suite dramatically. However, it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED to not use
        
      83.

            # ==> Configuration for :confirmable
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
            # A period that the user is allowed to access the website even without
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            # confirming his account. For instance, if set to 2.days, the user will be
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
            # able to access the website for two days without confirming his account,
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            # access will be blocked just in the third day. Default is 0.days, meaning
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
            # the user cannot access the website without confirming his account.
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
            # config.allow_unconfirmed_access_for = 2.days
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
          
        
      97.

            # If true, requires any email changes to be confirmed (exactly the same way as
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
            # initial account confirmation) to be applied. Requires additional unconfirmed_email
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
            # db field (see migrations). Until confirmed new email is stored in
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
            # unconfirmed email column, and copied to email column on successful confirmation.
        
      101.

          1

      123.

            # time the user will be asked for credentials again. Default is 30 minutes.

            # ==> Configuration for :lockable
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
            # Defines which strategy will be used to lock an account.
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
            # :failed_attempts = Locks an account after a number of failed attempts to sign in.
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
            # :none            = No lock strategy. You should handle locking by yourself.
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
            # config.lock_strategy = :failed_attempts
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
            # Defines which key will be used when locking and unlocking an account
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            # config.unlock_keys = [ :email ]
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
          
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
            # Defines which strategy will be used to unlock an account.
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            # :email = Sends an unlock link to the user email
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
            # :time  = Re-enables login after a certain amount of time (see :unlock_in below)
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
            # :both  = Enables both strategies
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
            # :none  = No unlock strategy. You should handle unlocking by yourself.
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
            # config.unlock_strategy = :both
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
          
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
            # Number of authentication tries before locking an account if lock_strategy
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            # is failed attempts.
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
            # config.maximum_attempts = 20
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
            # Time interval to unlock the account if :time is enabled as unlock_strategy.
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            # config.unlock_in = 1.hour
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          
        
      157.

            # ==> Configuration for :recoverable
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
            #
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
            # Defines which key will be used when recovering the password for an account
        
      160.

            # config.reset_password_keys = [ :email ]
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
          
        
      162.

            # Time interval you can reset your password with a reset password key.
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
            # Don't put a too small interval or your users won't have the time to
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            # change their passwords.
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          1
          
            config.reset_password_within = 6.hours
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
          
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
            # ==> Configuration for :encryptable
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
            # Allow you to use another encryption algorithm besides bcrypt (default). You can use
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            # :sha1, :sha512 or encryptors from others authentication tools as :clearance_sha1,
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
            # :authlogic_sha512 (then you should set stretches above to 20 for default behavior)
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
            # and :restful_authentication_sha1 (then you should set stretches to 10, and copy
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            # REST_AUTH_SITE_KEY to pepper)
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
            # config.encryptor = :sha512
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175.

            # ==> Scopes configuration

    180. 
          
          
            # Turn scoped views on. Before rendering "sessions/new", it will first check for
        
      181. 
      
        
    181.

      182.

      183. 
      
        
    183.

            # ==> Navigation configuration
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            # Lists the formats that should be treated as navigational. Formats like
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            # :html, should redirect to the sign in page when the user does not have
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
            # access, but formats like :xml or :json, should return 401.
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            #
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
            # If you have any extra navigational formats, like :iphone or :mobile, you
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
            # should add them to the navigational formats lists.
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
            #
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
            # The "*/*" below is required to match Internet Explorer requests.
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          1
          
            config.navigational_formats = ["*/*", :html, :json]
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
          
        
      204. 
      
        
    204.

      205.

      206.

            # ==> Mountable engine configurations
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
            # When using Devise inside an engine, let's call it `MyEngine`, and this engine
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
            # is mountable, there are some extra configurations to be taken into account.
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
            # The following options are available, assuming the engine is mounted as:
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            #
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
            #     mount MyEngine, at: "/my_engine"
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
            #
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
            # The router that invoked `devise_for`, in the example above, would be:
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
            # config.router_name = :my_engine
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
            #
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
            # When using omniauth, Devise cannot automatically set Omniauth path,
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
            # so you need to do it manually. For the users scope, it would be:
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
            # config.omniauth_path_prefix = "/my_engine/users/auth"
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
          end

    config/initializers/inflections.rb

    100.0 % covered

    2 relevant lines. 2 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # Be sure to restart your server when you modify this file.
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # Add new inflection rules using the following format
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          # (all these examples are active by default):

    config/initializers/tag_sanitization.rb

    100.0 % covered

    7 relevant lines. 7 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          1
          
          class TagSanitizationParser < ActsAsTaggableOn::GenericParser
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          1
          
            def parse
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
              ActsAsTaggableOn::TagList.new.tap do |tag_list|
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
                if @tag_list.is_a?(Array)
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          1
          
                  tag_list.add @tag_list.map{|s| Sanitize.fragment(s, Sanitize::Config.merge(Sanitize::Config::RELAXED, remove_contents: true)) }
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
                else
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          1
          
                  tag_list.add @tag_list.split(',').map(&:strip).map{|s| Sanitize.fragment(s, Sanitize::Config.merge(Sanitize::Config::RELAXED, remove_contents: true)) }
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
                end
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              end
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            end
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          end
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          1
          
          ActsAsTaggableOn.default_parser = TagSanitizationParser
        
      14.

              def cookie_value(url_params, cookies, referrer)
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
                cookie = {}
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          
        
      10.

          1
          
                if new_session?(referrer)

    11. 
          
          
                  # set / overwrite the utm cookie for the first page of a session
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          1
          
                  utm_params.each do |p|
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          1
          
                    url_params[p].present? ? cookie[p] = url_params[p] : cookie.delete(p)
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                  end
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          1

          1

            def self.delivering_email(message)

          module JsConnect

              def JsConnect.error(code, message)
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                return {"error" => code, "message" => message}
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              end
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          1
          
              def JsConnect.getJsConnectString(user, request = {}, client_id = "", secret = "", secure = true)
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          1
          
                error = nil
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          1
          
                timestamp = request["timestamp"].to_i
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
                current_timestamp = JsConnect.timestamp
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
                if secure
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                  # Make sure the request coming in is signed properly
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                  
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          1
          
                  if !request['client_id']
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                    error = JsConnect.error('invalid_request', 'The client_id parameter is missing.')
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                  elsif request['client_id'] != client_id
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                    error = JsConnect.error('invalid_client', "Unknown client #{request['client_id']}.")
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                  elsif request['timestamp'].nil? and request['signature'].nil?
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          1
          
                    if user and !user.empty?
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                      error = {'name' => user['name'], 'photourl' => user['photourl']}
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                    else
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          1
          
                      error = {'name' => '', 'photourl' => ''}
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                    end
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                  elsif request['timestamp'].nil?
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                    error = JsConnect.error('invalid_request', 'The timestamp is missing or invalid.')
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                  elsif !request['signature']
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                    error = JsConnect.error('invalid_request', 'The signature is missing.')
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                  elsif (current_timestamp - timestamp).abs > 30 * 60
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                    error = JsConnect.error('invalid_request', 'The timestamp is invalid.')
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                  else
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                    # Make sure the timestamp's signature checks out.
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                    timestamp_sig = Digest::MD5.hexdigest(timestamp.to_s + secret)
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                    if timestamp_sig != request['signature']
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                      error = JsConnect.error('access_denied', 'Signature invalid.')
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                    end
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                  end
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                end
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          1
          
                if error
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
                  result = error
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                elsif user and !user.empty?
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  result = user.clone
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                  JsConnect.signJsConnect(result, client_id, secret, true)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                else
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  result = {"name" => "", "photourl" => ""}
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                end
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          1
          
                json = ActiveSupport::JSON.encode(result);
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          1
          
                if request["callback"]
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          1
          
                  return "#{request["callback"]}(#{json});"
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                else
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                  return json
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              end
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          1
          
             def JsConnect.signJsConnect(data, client_id, secret, set_data = false)
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
               # Build the signature string. This is essentially a querystring representation of data, sorted by key
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
               keys = data.keys.sort { |a,b| a.downcase <=> b.downcase }
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
               
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
               sig_str = ""
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
               
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
               keys.each do |key|
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                if sig_str.length > 0
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  sig_str += "&"
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                 value = data[key]
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                 sig_str += CGI.escape(key) + "=" + CGI.escape(value)
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
               end
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
               
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
               signature = Digest::MD5.hexdigest(sig_str + secret);
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
               
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
               if set_data
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                 data["clientid"] = client_id
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                 data["signature"] = signature
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
               end
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
               return signature
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
             end
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
             
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          1
          
             def JsConnect.timestamp
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          1
          
               return Time.now.to_i
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
             end
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          end
        
      91.

            extend ActiveSupport::Concern

            # add your instance methods here

          1
          
            module ClassMethods
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          1
          
              def trend_by_day(attribute = :created_at)
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                # select("date(#{attribute}) as date, count(id) as stat").order('date ASC').group("date(#{attribute})").map{|a| {date: a.date, stat: a.stat.to_i}}
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                data = select("date(#{attribute}) as date, count(id) as stat").order('date ASC').group("date(#{attribute})")
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                daterange = (startdate..Date.today)
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                results = []
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                daterange.each do |date|
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                  data_point = data.select{|a| a.date.to_date == date}.first
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                  stat = data_point ? data_point.stat.to_i : 0
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                  results << [date, stat]
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                end
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                return results
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              end
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          1
          
              def max_by_day
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                trend_by_day.max_by{|a| a[1]}
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          1
          
              def startdate(attribute = :created_at)
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                order("#{attribute} asc").first.created_at.to_date
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              end
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            end
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          end
        
      31. 
      
        
    31.

          1
          
          ActiveRecord::Base.send(:include, Trend)
        
      33.
